ovdesc.p: This application can be used to apply common set of negotiation rules for more than one product. Instead of defining each of these rules individually in each of the designer of the product, the common set of rules (more than one rule) can be defined in EB.STANDARD.COMPARISON and this can be linked to the designer of the product property.
For example, a bank may have a restriction like all Loans disbursed should be in Multiple of 1000. Hence they may define Standard comparison type using the rule MULTIPLE (EB.COMPARISON.TYPE).

desc.p: Description of the record can be defined here.
This field denotes the DATA.TYPE for the rule. Valid inputs are AMT, D, R . Mandatory field
This field represents the id of the file EB.STANDARD.COMPARISON. Can be any alphanumeric characters.
This field denotes the file name to which the data is linked

This field denotes whether override or error message should be generated when the rule is broken.The allowed values are ERROR and OVERRIDE. The fields COMPARISON.TYPE, COMPARISON.VALUE and COMPARISON.MESSAGE form a associated multivalue set

This field denotes the actual rule that needs to be applied to the given attribute of the product property.The rules are defined in the file EB.COMPARISON.TYPE The fields COMPARISON.TYPE, COMPARISON.VALUE and COMPARISON.MESSAGE form a associated multivalue set

This field denotes the default value or the compare value which would be compared with the actual value in the arrangement. The value in this field should be compatible with the DATA.TYPE of the rule defined. The fields COMPARISON.TYPE, COMPARISON.VALUE and COMPARISON.MESSAGE form a associated multivalue set.
